headline: CarMax leans on AI, tech investments to trim $150M in costs
summary: Executives expect the technology enhancements to lower licensing usage and improve call center efficiency, among other benefits.

headline: CarMax Q2 Earnings Miss Expectations, Revenues Decline Y/Y
summary: KMX posts weaker Q2 with EPS and revenue misses, as used-vehicle sales, units, and financing income all decline year over year.

raw.headline: CarMax Q2 Earnings Miss Expectations, Revenues Decline Y/Y
raw.summary: KMX posts weaker Q2 with EPS and revenue misses, as used-vehicle sales, units, and financing income all decline year over year.

headline: The 5 Most Interesting Analyst Questions From CarMax’s Q3 Earnings Call
summary: CarMax’s third quarter results were met with a significant negative market reaction, reflecting both top-line and bottom-line misses relative to Wall Street’s expectations. Management attributed the underperformance to inventory and pricing missteps following a demand pull-forward caused by tariff speculation earlier in the year, as well as ongoing consumer caution. CEO Bill Nash explained that the company “fell into a spot where we weren’t as competitive” on pricing, which impacted sales volume
